{"id":1157045329,"question_id":42,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"4 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1706242438,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1157045329/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Trapping Rain Water","memory":"45.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int trap(int[] height) {\n        int len = height.length;\n        \n        int[] leftMax = new int[len];\n        \n        int max = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            max = Math.max(max, height[i]);\n            leftMax[i] = max;\n        }\n        \n        int[] rightMax = new int[len];\n        max=0;\n        \n        for(int i=len-1; i>=0; i--){\n            max = Math.max(max, height[i]);\n            rightMax[i] = max;\n        }\n        \n        int res =0 ;\n        for(int i=1; i<len-1; i++){\n            int val =  Math.min(leftMax[i-1], rightMax[i+1])-height[i];\n            \n            if(val>0)\n                res+=val;\n            // System.out.println(i + \" val=\"+val);\n                    \n            \n        }\n        \n        return res;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"trapping-rain-water","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
